DOC.brief_summary: The purpose research study test effectiveness standardize peer-led intervention teach self-management skill improve outcomes individual severe mental illness . The intervention know Wellness Recovery Action Planning WRAP , co-developed Dr. Mary Ellen Copeland . The focus inquiry whether develop individualized plan successful living : 1 ) lower psychiatric symptom ; 2 ) enhance psychosocial outcome self-perceived recovery , empowerment , self-advocacy , cop , social support ; 3 ) increase knowledge personal mental illness self-management strategy ; 4 ) enhances satisfaction service delivery system . The study evaluate follow hypothesis : Hypothesis # 1 : Compared wait-list control subject , participate WRAP intervention report reduce level psychiatric symptom . Hypothesis # 2 : Compared wait-list control subject , participate WRAP intervention report enhance enhanced feeling empowerment , hope , recovery , quality life , function . Hypothesis # 3 : Compared wait-list control , participate WRAP intervention report increase level social support . Hypothesis # 4 : Compared wait-list control , participate WRAP intervention report increase use peer service , high satisfaction service , low overall service cost . Hypothesis # 5 : Compared control , participate WRAP intervention report increase knowledge mental illness self-management , include making/using WRAP plan . Hypothesis # 6 : There difference employment rate control vs. intervention subject .
DOC.brief_title: Randomized Controlled Trial Wellness Recovery Action Planning
